hints.content:
Let's put our numbers into a place value table.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
- | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\maroonD{871}$ |  $\maroonD8$ | $\maroonD7$ | $\maroonD1$
$\blueE{140}$ | $\blueE1$ | $\blueE4$ | $\blueE0$

Now, we can break apart each number by place value.

$\maroonD{871}=\maroonD{8\text{ hundreds}} + \maroonD{7\text{ tens}} + \maroonD{1\text{ one}}$.  

$\blueE{140}= \blueE{1\text{ hundred}} + \blueE{4\text{ tens}}$.
$8\text{ hundreds} + 1 \text{ hundred}+7 \text{ tens}+4 \text{ tens}+1\text{ one}$ is the same as $871 + 140$.

question.content:
**Which expression could be used to find the value of $871+140$?**
